title: Favorite Books
text:
Currently I’m reading The Personal MBA, written by Josh Kaufman.
4 of my favorite books are

Siddhartha (by Herman Hesse)
Crime and Punishment (by Fyodor Dostoevksy)
Man’s Search for Meaning (by Victor Frankl)
Demian (by Herman Hesse)

title: Wooyong (Tommy) Park
text:
I am an undergraduate student in the School of Economics, Yonsei University.
I am joining the Stanford GSB as a predoctoral research fellow this summer, and my research interest lies in Applied Microeconomics and Causal Inference.

title: Slides and Materials
text:
Econometrics

Applied Economic Methods Study Group(Yonsei University)
I started out this study group in July(2024) with students in the Economics department who aim for attaining PhD in Applied Economics. We are planning to have this study group every twice a year, passing on the materials and resources to future students as well. I gave presentations on topics including clustering standard errors and staggered difference-in-differences.

Cluster Robust Standard Errors
Staggered Difference-in-Differences I
Staggered Difference-in-Differences II(R)
Staggered Difference-in-Differences II(Stata)



Not presented

Cox PH models for Survival Analysis
